experiences.title: Founding Engineer
bullets: AI for Game Theory.

experiences.title: Visiting Researcher
experiences.description: Working with Prof. Dorsa Sadigh & Toyota Research Institute on shared autonomy algorithms. Developed NMPC expert agent achieving 96% success rate in parallel parking tasks.
bullets: Collaborated with Toyota Research Institute to develop shared autonomy algorithms using zone of proximal development (ZPD), validated in CARLA user studies.
Built a two-phase NMPC expert agent for parallel parking in CARLA, achieving 96% success by blending expert and user control.
Iterated on trajectory analysis with NumPy/Pandas to refine controller behavior based on user feedback.

experiences.title: Undergraduate Researcher
experiences.description: Co-first-author on GAMMA (RSS 2025). Adapted Action Chunking Transformer to ALOHA robot achieving 90% success rate. Built gaze-assisted robotic control improving speed by 250%.
bullets: Adapted the Action Chunking Transformer (ACT) to a custom ALOHA setup, achieving 90% success on bimanual manipulation via hardware-specific PyTorch changes.
Fused Meta Aria gaze streams with LLM/VLM infrastructure for real-time intent prediction, boosting task speed by 250%.
Led a collaboration with OpenAI to apply generative AI to athletic training for automated feedback.

experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern
experiences.description: Built Java catalog compiler processing 7M+ titles/day. Automated metadata ingestion eliminating 90% of errors. Integrated with Apple, Google, Samsung for cross-platform deployment.
bullets: Built and deployed a Java catalog compiler to automate ingest for 7M+ titles/day, cutting catalog ingestion errors by 90% for the Amazon Studios Export team.
Automated schema validation and metadata transformation across the Prime Video catalog using AWS S3 and Athena.
Authored integration design and aligned requirements with Apple/Google/Samsung and internal stakeholders to unblock rollout.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description: Optimized React website reducing bundle size 40% and supporting 60k+ concurrent users. Built 'Olivier' RAG chatbot using Pinecone + Redis + OpenAI. Designed Redis caching absorbing 80% of read traffic.
bullets: Refactored React frontend and backend infrastructure to reduce bundle size by 40% and improve response time by 25%, supporting 60k+ concurrent users.
Designed a Redis cache (TTL + key strategy) that absorbed ~80% read traffic across 500k+ monthly page views.
Built a RAG chatbot with Pinecone, Redis, and OpenAI, adding engagement and fallback metrics.

experiences.title: Computer Vision Intern
experiences.description: Built VLM annotation tool using PaliGemma + OWL-ViT improving labeling throughput by 50%. Created image augmentation pipeline increasing dataset size 6× and boosting model accuracy by 5%.
bullets: Built a Python tool using Google PaliGemma and OWL VLMs to automate labeling, boosting throughput by 50%.
Resolved cross-platform bugs across Python, shell scripts, and Docker to stabilize MacOS and Windows deployments.
Designed an image augmentation pipeline that expanded datasets 6x and improved model accuracy by 5%.

experiences.title: Graduate Research Advisor
experiences.description: Led swimmer action recognition research using YOLOv7 + OpenPose + CNN. Published at IEEE SSIAI 2024. Co-authored GPU vs FPGA benchmark thesis. Advised M.S. student on GAN-based action recognition.
bullets: Advised an M.S. thesis on GAN-based pose estimation for action recognition, guiding model development and evaluation.
Partnered with the student to troubleshoot training and deployment issues, ensuring successful thesis completion.

experiences.title: Visiting Researcher
experiences.description: Led swimmer action recognition research using YOLOv7 + OpenPose + CNN. Published at IEEE SSIAI 2024. Co-authored GPU vs FPGA benchmark thesis. Advised M.S. student on GAN-based action recognition.
bullets: Led a 3-person team to develop OpenPose + YOLOv7 pipelines with CNN/MLP models for swimmer action recognition.
Improved accuracy and real-time performance by 30% via preprocessing algorithms and data augmentation.
Processed 13+ hours of underwater footage to build a cleaned, labeled dataset for stroke classification.

experiences.title: Laboratory Intern
experiences.description: Led swimmer action recognition research using YOLOv7 + OpenPose + CNN. Published at IEEE SSIAI 2024. Co-authored GPU vs FPGA benchmark thesis. Advised M.S. student on GAN-based action recognition.
bullets: Co-authored a thesis benchmarking NVIDIA GeForce, Jetson Nano, and AMD Kria across 20+ models, showing NVIDIA GPUs averaged 5% higher accuracy.
Developed standardized testing scripts to ensure reproducible benchmarking across hardware and frameworks.
Implemented data augmentation techniques to improve pose recognition generalization.
